Professionally, Claudiu Popa is a trusted advisor to government agencies, municipalities, non-profit organizations, businesses of all sizes and NGOs on matters of regulatory compliance, information security strategy and risk management. In addition to being an educator through the University of Toronto, Seneca College, Ontario Tech University, the Standards Council of Canada, provincial Law Societies and Privacy Commissioner Offices, Claudiu Popa is also a certified professional who acts as an interim CISO, CPO, DPO, breach coach or board level Risk Advisor. With over 30 years of experience in information technology security, auditing, international standards, and board-level risk advisory, he is no stranger to sharing his wealth of knowledge with eager audiences. Expertise: Strategic Thinking Innovation & Creativity Business Technology Personal Growth Artificial Intelligence (AI) Emerging Technologies Big Data / DLP Cyber Security Teamwork STEM + Claudiu Popa has been the founder since 1989 of the Informatica Group of Companies. Claudiu Popa is also the co-founder of Canada’s only cybersafety education foundation, KnowledgeFlow. Since 2009, the Foundation has been home to the famous UnHackable brand that empowers Canada’s youth to embrace a culture of cyber safety and build a Circle of Trust within their communities. Among other innovations, he is behind the Verify Risk Assessment methodology used by businesses and government agencies across Canada. With a deeply technical background and a computer science degree from York University’s Faculty of Pure and Applied Science Claudiu Popa is also proud to hold the industry’s top certifications in risk, privacy, security, business continuity and project leadership. Additionally, Claudiu Popa is a published author of three books on cyberfraud and data protection, podcaster and frequent media commentator whose informed insights are featured on the national news most weeks. As the author of the BS (Bad Security) Blog he takes pleasure in exposing the mistakes of incompetent crooks as well as the unethical practices of predatory groups. Claudiu has deep domain expertise and is engaged in the active study of diverse but related topics including education technology (edtech), financial cybersecurity (fintech), disinformation and influence operations (cyberwarfare), social engineering, personal & corporate identity theft (copyright takedowns), incident response and breach simulations (TTX), secure development (SDLC), surveillance technologies and physical security. Claudiu Popa is also an information security technologist whose primary research on cybercrime, digital literacy, cyberfraud, national security, intellectual property protection and personal information breach prevention has been published and featured extensively through hundreds of articles, books and conference talks. Claudiu Popa is a university adjunct professor and college lecturer, having worked extensively with standards bodies, educational institutions and task forces on international standards like ISO, PCI, SOX, PbD and numerous others. All efforts are a testament to Claudiu’s passion in support of raising the bar on data security and the protection of human rights, particularly in the age of ubiquitous cloud storage, generative AI and edge computing. -- Topics & Categories Business Management Motivational Speakers Communication Future Trends Global Issues Law & Legal Issues Leadership Risk & Risk Management Social Media | Internet of Things Team-Work & Collaboration Technology & AI Trainers Trust & Ethics Urbanism | Cities Claudiu Popa offers over 50 different topics and is happy to customize his talks to your industry, organization, association, and audienc e.
